00127 int cache_inode_compare_key_fsal(  hash_buffer_t * buff1, hash_buffer_t * buff2 ) 
00128 {
00129   fsal_status_t             status;
00130   cache_inode_fsal_data_t * pfsdata1 = NULL ;
00131   cache_inode_fsal_data_t * pfsdata2 = NULL ;
00132   
00133   /* Test if one of teh entries are NULL */
00134   if( buff1->pdata == NULL )
00135     return ( buff2->pdata == NULL ) ? 0 : 1 ;
00136   else
00137     {
00138       if( buff2->pdata== NULL )
00139         return -1 ; /* left member is the greater one */
00140       else
00141         {
00142           int rc ;
00143           pfsdata1 = (cache_inode_fsal_data_t *)(buff1->pdata) ;
00144           pfsdata2 = (cache_inode_fsal_data_t *)(buff2->pdata) ;
00145       
00146           rc = ( !FSAL_handlecmp( &pfsdata1->handle, &pfsdata2->handle, &status)   
00147                  &&  ( pfsdata1->cookie == pfsdata2->cookie ) ) ? 0 : 1 ; 
00148 
00149           return rc ;
00150         }
00151       
00152     }
00153   /* This line should never be reached */
00154 } /* cache_inode_compare_key_fsal */
00155 
00171 int cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( hash_buffer_t * pkey, cache_inode_fsal_data_t * pfsdata, cache_inode_client_t  * pclient )
00172 {
00173   cache_inode_fsal_data_t * ppoolfsdata = NULL ;
00174   
00175   /* Allocate a new key for storing data, if this a set, not a get
00176    * in the case of a 'get' key, pclient == NULL and * pfsdata is used */
00177 
00178 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00179   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00180   BuddySetDebugLabel( "cache_inode_fsal_data_t:conversion" ) ;
00181 #endif
00182 
00183   if( pclient != NULL )
00184     {
00185       GET_PREALLOC( ppoolfsdata, 
00186                     pclient->pool_key, 
00187                     pclient->nb_prealloc,  
00188                     cache_inode_fsal_data_t , 
00189                     next_alloc ) ;
00190       if( ppoolfsdata == NULL )
00191         {
00192           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "Can't allocate a new key from cache pool" ) ;
00193           return 1 ;
00194         }
00195       
00196       *ppoolfsdata = *pfsdata ;
00197       
00198       pkey->pdata = (caddr_t)ppoolfsdata ;
00199     }
00200   else
00201     pkey->pdata = (caddr_t)pfsdata ;
00202 
00203 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00204   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00205   BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00206 #endif
00207   
00208   pkey->len = sizeof( cache_inode_fsal_data_t ) ;
00209 
00210   return 0 ;
00211 } /* cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key */
00212 
00225 void cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key(  hash_buffer_t * pkey, cache_inode_client_t  * pclient )
00226 {
00227   cache_inode_fsal_data_t * ppoolfsdata = NULL ;
00228 
00229   ppoolfsdata = (cache_inode_fsal_data_t *)pkey->pdata ;
00230 
00231   RELEASE_PREALLOC( ppoolfsdata, pclient->pool_key, next_alloc ) ; 
00232 } /* cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key */
00233 
00255 cache_entry_t * cache_inode_new_entry( cache_inode_fsal_data_t  * pfsdata, 
00256                                        fsal_attrib_list_t       * pfsal_attr,
00257                                        cache_inode_file_type_t    type,
00258                                        cache_inode_create_arg_t * pcreate_arg, 
00259                                        cache_entry_t            * pentry_dir_prev,
00260                                        hash_table_t             * ht,
00261                                        cache_inode_client_t     * pclient,
00262                                        fsal_op_context_t        * pcontext, 
00263                                        unsigned int               create_flag,
00264                                        cache_inode_status_t     * pstatus)
00265 { 
00266   cache_entry_t              * pentry = NULL ;
00267   cache_inode_dir_data_t     * pdir_data = NULL ;
00268   hash_buffer_t                key, value ;
00269   fsal_attrib_list_t           fsal_attributes;
00270   fsal_status_t                fsal_status ;
00271   cache_content_status_t       cache_content_status ;
00272   int                          i = 0 ;
00273   int                          rc = 0 ;
00274   off_t                        size_in_cache ; 
00275  
00276   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
00277   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00278 
00279   /* stat */
00280   pclient->stat.nb_call_total += 1 ;
00281   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_call[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00282   
00283   /* Turn the input to a hash key */
00284   if( cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( &key, pfsdata, NULL ) )
00285     {
00286       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_UNAPPROPRIATED_KEY ;
00287 
00288       /* stat */
00289       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;     
00290       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;
00291 
00292       return NULL ;
00293     }
00294 
00295   /* Check if the entry doesn't already exists */
00296   if( HashTable_Get( ht, &key, &value ) == HASHTABLE_SUCCESS   )
00297     {
00298       /* Entry is already in the cache, do not add it */
00299       pentry = (cache_entry_t *)value.pdata ;
00300       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00301 
00302       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG,
00303             "cache_inode_new_entry: Trying to add an already existing entry. Found entry type: %d State: %d, New type: %d",
00304             pentry->internal_md.type, pentry->internal_md.valid_state, type );
00305       
00306       /* stat */
00307       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00308 
00309       return pentry ;
00310     }
00311   
00312 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00313   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00314   BuddySetDebugLabel( "cache_entry_t" ) ;
00315 #endif
00316 
00317   GET_PREALLOC( pentry, 
00318                 pclient->pool_entry, 
00319                 pclient->nb_prealloc, 
00320                 cache_entry_t, 
00321                 next_alloc ) ;
00322   if( pentry == NULL )
00323     {
00324       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "Can't allocate a new entry from cache pool" ) ;
00325       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00326 
00327        /* stat */
00328       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00329 
00330       return NULL ;
00331     }
00332 
00333 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00334   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00335   BuddySetDebugLabel( "cache_inode_dir_data_t" ) ;
00336 #endif
00337 
00338   /* if entry is of tyep DIR_CONTINUE or DIR_BEGINNING, it should have a pdir_data */
00339   if( type == DIR_BEGINNING || type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00340     {
00341       GET_PREALLOC( pdir_data,
00342                     pclient->pool_dir_data, 
00343                     pclient->nb_pre_dir_data,
00344                     cache_inode_dir_data_t,
00345                     next_alloc );
00346       if( pdir_data == NULL )
00347         {
00348           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "Can't allocate a new dir_data from cache pool" ) ;
00349           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00350           
00351           /* stat */
00352       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00353       
00354       return NULL ;
00355         }
00356 
00357       if( type == DIR_BEGINNING )
00358         pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data = pdir_data ;
00359       else
00360         pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data = pdir_data ;
00361     } /*  if( type == DIR_BEGINNING || type == DIR_CONTINUE ) */
00362    
00363 
00364 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00365   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00366   BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00367 #endif
00368 
00369   if( rw_lock_init( &(pentry->lock) ) !=0 ) 
00370     {
00371       RELEASE_PREALLOC(  pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
00372       DisplayErrorJd( pclient->log_outputs, ERR_SYS, ERR_PTHREAD_MUTEX_INIT, errno ) ;
00373       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INIT_ENTRY_FAILED ;
00374 
00375       /* stat */
00376       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_retryable[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00377       
00378       return NULL ;
00379     }
00380     
00381   /* Call FSAL to get information about the object if not provided, except for DIR_CONTINUE 
00382    * that points to their DIR_BEGINNING .
00383    * If attributes are provided as pfsal_attr parameter, use them. Call FSAL_getattrs otherwise. */
00384   if( pfsal_attr == NULL )
00385     {
00386       /* No attributes are provided, use FSAL_getattrs to query them. */
00387       if( type != DIR_CONTINUE )
00388         {
00389           fsal_attributes.asked_attributes= pclient->attrmask  ; 
00390           fsal_status =  FSAL_getattrs( &pfsdata->handle, pcontext, &fsal_attributes ) ;
00391 
00392           if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00393             {
00394               /* Put the entry back in its pool */
00395               DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: FSAL_getattrs failed" ) ;
00396               RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pclient->pool_entry,  next_alloc ) ;
00397               *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00398              
00399               if( fsal_status.major == ERR_FSAL_STALE )
00400                 {
00401                   cache_inode_status_t kill_status ;
00402 
00403                   DisplayLog( "cache_inode_new_entry: Stale FSAL File Handle detected for pentry = %p", pentry ) ;
00404 
00405                   if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00406                     DisplayLog( "cache_inode_new_entry: Could not kill entry %p, status = %u", pentry, kill_status ) ;
00407 
00408                 } 
00409               /* stat */
00410               pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00411               
00412               return NULL ;
00413             }
00414         }
00415     }
00416   else
00417     {
00418       /* Use the provided attributes */
00419       fsal_attributes = *pfsal_attr ;
00420     }
00421   
00422   /* Init the internal metadata */
00423   pentry->internal_md.type          = type ;
00424   pentry->internal_md.valid_state   = VALID ;
00425   pentry->internal_md.read_time     = 0 ;
00426   pentry->internal_md.mod_time      = pentry->internal_md.alloc_time = time( NULL ) ;
00427   pentry->internal_md.refresh_time  = pentry->internal_md.alloc_time ;
00428  
00429   pentry->gc_lru_entry        = NULL ;
00430   pentry->gc_lru              = NULL ;
00431   
00432   /* No parent for now, it will be added in cache_inode_add_cached_dirent */
00433   pentry->parent_list = NULL ;
00434 
00435   
00436   switch( type )
00437     {
00438     case REGULAR_FILE: 
00439       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a REGULAR_FILE" ) ;
00440 
00441       pentry->object.file.handle                = pfsdata->handle ;
00442 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00443       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.file.handle ;
00444 #endif
00445       pentry->object.file.attributes            = fsal_attributes ;
00446       pentry->object.file.pentry_content        = NULL ;   /* Not yet a File Content entry associated with this entry */
00447       pentry->object.file.state_head_counter    = 0 ;      /* No associated client yet                                */
00448       pentry->object.file.state_current_counter = 0 ;      /* No associated client yet                                */
00449       pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno        = -1 ;
00450       pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op       = 0 ;
00451       pentry->object.file.open_fd.openflags     = 0 ;
00452       memset( &(pentry->object.file.open_fd.fd), 0, sizeof( fsal_file_t ) ) ;
00453 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
00454       pentry->object.file.pname = NULL ;
00455       pentry->object.file.pentry_parent_open = NULL ;
00456 #endif
00457 
00458       break ;
00459         
00460     case DIR_BEGINNING:
00461       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a DIR_BEGINNING" ) ;
00462 
00463       pentry->object.dir_begin.handle = pfsdata->handle ;
00464 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00465       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.dir_begin.handle;
00466 #endif
00467       pentry->object.dir_begin.attributes = fsal_attributes ; 
00468 
00469       pentry->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir = CACHE_INODE_NO ;
00470       pentry->object.dir_begin.end_of_dir = END_OF_DIR ;
00471       pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont = NULL ;
00472       pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_last = pentry ;
00473       pentry->object.dir_begin.nbactive = 0 ;
00474       pentry->object.dir_begin.nbdircont = 0 ;
00475       
00476       for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00477         {
00478           pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active = INVALID ;
00479           pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry = NULL ;
00480           FSAL_str2name( "", 1, &pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name ) ;
00481         }
00482       
00483       break;
00484 
00485     case DIR_CONTINUE:
00486       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a DIR_CONTINUE" ) ;
00487 
00488       pentry->object.dir_cont.end_of_dir = END_OF_DIR ;
00489       pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont = NULL ; /* The last entry has no next entry */
00490       pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_prev = pentry_dir_prev ; 
00491 
00492       switch( pentry_dir_prev->internal_md.type )
00493         {
00494         case DIR_BEGINNING:
00495           pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin = pentry_dir_prev ;
00496           pentry->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos = 1 ; /* The first after the DIR_BEGINNIG */
00497           break ;
00498           
00499         case DIR_CONTINUE:
00500           pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin = pentry_dir_prev->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin ;
00501           pentry->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos = pentry_dir_prev->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos + 1 ;
00502           break ;
00503           
00504         default:
00505           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_A_DIRECTORY ;
00506           RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pclient->pool_entry,  next_alloc ) ;
00507 
00508           /* stat */
00509           pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00510 
00511           return NULL ;
00512           break ;
00513         }
00514 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00515       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->mobject.handle ;
00516 #endif
00517       pentry->object.dir_cont.nbactive = 0 ;
00518       for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
00519         { 
00520           pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active = INVALID ;
00521           pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry = NULL ;
00522           FSAL_str2name( "", 1, &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name ) ; 
00523         }
00524       break ;
00525       
00526     case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
00527       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a SYMBOLIC_LINK" ) ;
00528       
00529       pentry->object.symlink.handle = pfsdata->handle ;
00530 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00531       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.symlink.handle ;
00532 #endif
00533       pentry->object.symlink.attributes = fsal_attributes ;
00534       fsal_status = FSAL_pathcpy( &pentry->object.symlink.content, &pcreate_arg->link_content ) ;
00535       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status ) ) 
00536         {
00537           *pstatus = cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status ) ;
00538           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: FSAL_pathcpy failed" ) ;
00539           RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pclient->pool_entry,  next_alloc ) ;
00540         }
00541       
00542       break ;
00543 
00544     case SOCKET_FILE: 
00545       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a SOCKET_FILE" ) ;
00546 
00547       pentry->object.special_obj.handle         = pfsdata->handle ;
00548 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00549       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.special_obj.handle ;
00550 #endif
00551       pentry->object.special_obj.attributes     = fsal_attributes ;
00552       break ;
00553 
00554     case FIFO_FILE: 
00555       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a FIFO_FILE" ) ;
00556 
00557       pentry->object.special_obj.handle         = pfsdata->handle ;
00558 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00559       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.special_obj.handle ;
00560 #endif
00561       pentry->object.special_obj.attributes     = fsal_attributes ;
00562       break ;
00563       
00564     case BLOCK_FILE:
00565       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a BLOCK_FILE" ) ;
00566 
00567       pentry->object.special_obj.handle         = pfsdata->handle ;
00568 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00569       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.special_obj.handle ;
00570 #endif
00571       pentry->object.special_obj.attributes     = fsal_attributes ;
00572       break ;
00573       
00574     case CHARACTER_FILE: 
00575       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Adding a CHARACTER_FILE" ) ;
00576 
00577       pentry->object.special_obj.handle          = pfsdata->handle ;
00578 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
00579       pentry->mobject.handle = pentry->object.special_obj.handle ;
00580 #endif
00581       pentry->object.special_obj.attributes      = fsal_attributes ;
00582       break ;
00583              
00584     default:
00585       /* Should never happen */
00586       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INCONSISTENT_ENTRY ;
00587       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, "/!\\ | cache_inode_new_entry: unknown type provided" ) ;
00588       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pclient->pool_entry,  next_alloc ) ;
00589 
00590       /* stat */
00591       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00592       
00593       return NULL ;
00594     }
00595 
00596    /* Turn the input to a hash key */
00597   if( cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( &key, pfsdata, pclient ) )
00598     {
00599       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_UNAPPROPRIATED_KEY ;
00600 
00601       /* stat */
00602       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;      
00603       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient ) ;      
00604 
00605       return NULL ;
00606     }
00607 
00608   /* Adding the entry in the cache */
00609   value.pdata = (caddr_t)pentry ;
00610   value.len = sizeof( cache_entry_t ) ;
00611 
00612   if( ( rc = HashTable_Test_And_Set( ht, &key, &value, HASHTABLE_SET_HOW_SET_NO_OVERWRITE ) ) != HASHTABLE_SUCCESS )
00613     {
00614       /* Put the entry back in its pool */
00615       RELEASE_PREALLOC(  pentry, pclient->pool_entry,  next_alloc ) ;
00616       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, 
00617                          NIV_EVENT, 
00618                          "cache_inode_new_entry: entry could not be added to hash, rc=%d", 
00619                          rc ) ;
00620       
00621       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_HASH_SET_ERROR ;
00622 
00623       /* stat */
00624       pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_err_unrecover[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00625       
00626       return NULL ;
00627     }
00628 
00629   /* if entry is a REGULAR_FILE and has a related data cache entry from a previous server instance that crashed, recover it */  
00630   /* This is done only when this is not a creation (when creating a new file, it is impossible to have it cached)           */
00631   if( type == REGULAR_FILE && create_flag == FALSE )
00632    {
00633       cache_content_test_cached( pentry, 
00634                                  (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client, 
00635                                  pcontext, 
00636                                  &cache_content_status ) ;
00637 
00638       if( cache_content_status == CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS ) 
00639         {
00640            DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: Entry %p is already datacached, recovering...", pentry ) ;
00641 
00642            /* Adding the cached entry to the data cache */
00643            if( (  pentry->object.file.pentry_content= cache_content_new_entry( pentry,
00644                                                                                NULL,
00645                                                                                (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client,
00646                                                                                RECOVER_ENTRY,
00647                                                                                pcontext,
00648                                                                                &cache_content_status ) ) == NULL )
00649              {
00650               DisplayLogJd(  pclient->log_outputs, "Error recovering cached data for pentry %p", pentry ) ;
00651              }
00652             else
00653               DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, "Cached data added successfully for pentry %p", pentry ) ;
00654             
00655            /* Recover the size from the data cache too... */ 
00656            if(  ( size_in_cache = cache_content_get_cached_size( (cache_content_entry_t *)pentry->object.file.pentry_content ) ) == -1 )
00657              {
00658                 DisplayLogJd(  pclient->log_outputs, "Error when recovering size in cache for pentry %p", pentry ) ;
00659              }
00660            else
00661              pentry->object.file.attributes.filesize = (fsal_size_t)size_in_cache ;
00662 
00663         }
00664    } 
00665 
00666 
00667   /* Final step */
00668   P_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00669   *pstatus = cache_inode_valid( pentry, CACHE_INODE_OP_GET, pclient ) ;
00670   V_w( &pentry->lock ) ;
00671 
00672   
00673   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "cache_inode_new_entry: New entry %p added", pentry ) ;
00674   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS  ;
00675   
00676   /* stat */
00677   pclient->stat.func_stats.nb_success[CACHE_INODE_NEW_ENTRY] += 1 ;
00678 
00679   return pentry ;
00680 } /* cache_inode_new_entry */
00681 
00693 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_clean_entry( cache_entry_t * pentry )
00694 {
00695   pentry->internal_md.type         = RECYCLED ;
00696   pentry->internal_md.valid_state  = INVALID ;
00697   pentry->internal_md.read_time    = 0 ;
00698   pentry->internal_md.mod_time     = 0 ;
00699   pentry->internal_md.refresh_time = 0 ;
00700   pentry->internal_md.alloc_time   = 0 ;
00701   return CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00702 }
00703 
00715 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_error_convert( fsal_status_t fsal_status )
00716 {
00717   switch( fsal_status.major )
00718     {
00719     case ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR:
00720       return CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00721       break ;
00722       
00723     case ERR_FSAL_NOENT:
00724       return  CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND ;
00725       break ;
00726       
00727     case ERR_FSAL_EXIST:
00728       return CACHE_INODE_ENTRY_EXISTS ;
00729       break ;
00730       
00731     case ERR_FSAL_ACCESS:
00732       return CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EACCESS ;
00733       break ;
00734 
00735     case ERR_FSAL_PERM:
00736       return CACHE_INODE_FSAL_EPERM ;
00737       break ;
00738 
00739     case ERR_FSAL_NOSPC:
00740       return CACHE_INODE_NO_SPACE_LEFT ;
00741       break ;
00742       
00743     case ERR_FSAL_NOTEMPTY:
00744       return  CACHE_INODE_DIR_NOT_EMPTY ;
00745       break ;
00746 
00747     case ERR_FSAL_ROFS:
00748       return CACHE_INODE_READ_ONLY_FS  ;
00749       break ;
00750 
00751     case ERR_FSAL_NOTDIR:
00752       return CACHE_INODE_NOT_A_DIRECTORY ;
00753       break ;
00754 
00755     case ERR_FSAL_IO:
00756       return CACHE_INODE_IO_ERROR ;
00757       break ;
00758 
00759     case ERR_FSAL_STALE:
00760       return CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ESTALE ;
00761       break ;
00762   
00763     case ERR_FSAL_INVAL:
00764       return CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00765       break ;
00766 
00767     case ERR_FSAL_DQUOT:
00768       return CACHE_INODE_QUOTA_EXCEEDED ;
00769       break ;
00770   
00771     case ERR_FSAL_SEC:
00772       return CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERR_SEC ;
00773       break ;
00774 
00775     case ERR_FSAL_NOTSUPP:
00776       return CACHE_INODE_NOT_SUPPORTED ;
00777       break ;
00778 
00779     case ERR_FSAL_DELAY:
00780      return CACHE_INODE_FSAL_DELAY ;
00781      break ;
00782 
00783     default:
00784       /* generic FSAL error */
00785       DisplayLog("cache_inode_error_convert: default conversion to CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR for error %d,%d", fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
00786       return  CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR   ;
00787       break ;
00788     }
00789 
00790   /* We should never reach this line, this may produce a warning with certain compiler */
00791   DisplayLog("cache_inode_error_convert: default conversion to CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR for error %d, this line should never be reached", 
00792             fsal_status.major, __LINE__ ) ;
00793   return  CACHE_INODE_FSAL_ERROR   ;
00794 } /* cache_inode_error_convert */
00795 
00811 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_valid( cache_entry_t * pentry, 
00812                                         cache_inode_op_t op,
00813                                         cache_inode_client_t * pclient )
00814 {
00815   /* /!\ NOTE THIS CAREFULLY: entry is supposed to be locked when this function is called !! */
00816 
00817   cache_inode_status_t     cache_status ; 
00818   cache_content_status_t   cache_content_status ;
00819   LRU_status_t             lru_status ;
00820   LRU_entry_t            * plru_entry = NULL ;
00821   cache_content_client_t * pclient_content = NULL ;
00822   cache_content_entry_t  * pentry_content = NULL ;
00823 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM
00824   buddy_stats_t    __attribute__(( __unused__ ))    bstats;
00825 #endif
00826 
00827   if( pentry == NULL )
00828     return CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
00829 
00830   /* for DIR_CONTINUES, process the call on main dir entry */
00831   if ( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
00832   {
00833      return cache_inode_valid( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin,
00834                     op, pclient );
00835   }
00836   
00837   /* Invalidate former entry if needed */
00838   if( pentry->gc_lru != NULL && pentry->gc_lru_entry )
00839     {
00840       if( LRU_invalidate( pentry->gc_lru, pentry->gc_lru_entry ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00841         {
00842           RELEASE_PREALLOC(  pentry, pclient->pool_entry,  next_alloc ) ;
00843           return  CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00844         }
00845     }
00846   
00847   if( ( plru_entry = LRU_new_entry( pclient->lru_gc, &lru_status ) ) == NULL )
00848     {
00849       RELEASE_PREALLOC(  pentry, pclient->pool_entry,  next_alloc ) ;
00850       return CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00851     }
00852   plru_entry->buffdata.pdata = (caddr_t)pentry ;
00853   plru_entry->buffdata.len = sizeof( cache_entry_t ) ;
00854 
00855   /* Setting the anchors */
00856   pentry->gc_lru = pclient->lru_gc ;
00857   pentry->gc_lru_entry = plru_entry ;
00858   
00859   /* Update internal md */
00860   pentry->internal_md.valid_state = VALID ;
00861 
00862   if( op == CACHE_INODE_OP_GET )
00863     pentry->internal_md.read_time = time( NULL ) ;
00864   
00865   if( op == CACHE_INODE_OP_SET )
00866     {
00867       pentry->internal_md.mod_time = time( NULL ) ;
00868       pentry->internal_md.refresh_time = pentry->internal_md.mod_time ;
00869     }
00870   
00871   /* Add a call to the GC counter */
00872   pclient->call_since_last_gc += 1 ;
00873  
00874   /* If open/close fd cache is used for FSAL, manage it here */ 
00875 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00876   printf( "--------> use_cache=%u fileno=%d last_op=%u time(NULL)=%u delta=%d retention=%u\n",
00877         pclient->use_cache, pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno ,  pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op, time(NULL),
00878         time( NULL ) - pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op, pclient->retention ) ;
00879 #endif
00880   if( pentry->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE ) 
00881    {
00882      if( pclient->use_cache == 1) 
00883        {
00884         if( pentry->object.file.open_fd.fileno >= 0 )
00885           {
00886              if( time( NULL ) - pentry->object.file.open_fd.last_op > pclient->retention ) 
00887                {
00888                    if( cache_inode_close( pentry, pclient, &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00889                      {
00890                        /* Bad close */
00891                        return cache_status ;
00892                      }
00893                }        
00894           }
00895        }
00896 
00897       /* Same of local fd cache */
00898       pclient_content = (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client ;
00899       pentry_content = (cache_content_entry_t *)pentry->object.file.pentry_content ;
00900 
00901       if( pentry_content != NULL ) 
00902         if( pclient_content->use_cache == 1 ) 
00903               if( pentry_content->local_fs_entry.opened_file.local_fd > 0 )
00904                 if( time( NULL ) - pentry_content->local_fs_entry.opened_file.last_op  > pclient_content->retention )
00905                       if( cache_content_close( pentry_content, pclient_content, &cache_content_status ) != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
00906                         return CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_ERROR ;
00907     }
00908  
00909 #ifdef _DEBUG_CACHE_INODE
00910   /* Log */
00911 
00912 #ifndef _NO_BUDDY_SYSTEM 
00913   BuddyGetStats( &bstats ) ;
00914   printf( "(pthread_self=%u) NbStandard=%lu  NbStandardUsed=%lu  InsideStandard(nb=%lu, size=%lu)\n", 
00915           pthread_self(),
00916           bstats.NbStdPages, 
00917           bstats.NbStdUsed, 
00918           bstats.StdUsedSpace, 
00919           bstats.NbStdUsed) ;
00920 #endif
00921   printf( "(pthread_self=%u) LRU GC state: nb_entries=%d nb_invalid=%d nb_call_gc=%d param.nb_call_gc_invalid=%d\n", 
00922           pthread_self(), pclient->lru_gc->nb_entry, pclient->lru_gc->nb_invalid, 
00923           pclient->lru_gc->nb_call_gc, pclient->lru_gc->parameter.nb_call_gc_invalid ) ;
00924   
00925   printf( "LRU GC state: nb_entries=%d nb_invalid=%d nb_call_gc=%d param.nb_call_gc_invalid=%d\n", 
00926                      pclient->lru_gc->nb_entry, pclient->lru_gc->nb_invalid, 
00927                      pclient->lru_gc->nb_call_gc, pclient->lru_gc->parameter.nb_call_gc_invalid ) ;
00928 
00929   DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
00930                      "LRU GC state: nb_entries=%d nb_invalid=%d nb_call_gc=%d param.nb_call_gc_invalid=%d", 
00931                      pclient->lru_gc->nb_entry, pclient->lru_gc->nb_invalid, 
00932                      pclient->lru_gc->nb_call_gc, pclient->lru_gc->parameter.nb_call_gc_invalid ) ;
00933 #endif
00934 
00935   /* Call LRU_gc_invalid to get ride of the unused invalid lru entries */
00936   if( LRU_gc_invalid( pclient->lru_gc, NULL ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
00937     return CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR ;
00938 
00939   return  CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
00940 } /* cache_inode_valid */
00941 
00942 
00955 void cache_inode_get_attributes( cache_entry_t * pentry, fsal_attrib_list_t * pattr )
00956 {
00957   /* The pentry is supposed to be locked */
00958   switch( pentry->internal_md.type )
00959     {
00960     case REGULAR_FILE:
00961       *pattr = pentry->object.file.attributes ;
00962       break ;
00963       
00964     case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
00965       *pattr = pentry->object.symlink.attributes ;
00966       break ;
00967       
00968     case DIR_BEGINNING:
00969       *pattr = pentry->object.dir_begin.attributes ;
00970       break ;
00971       
00972     case DIR_CONTINUE:
00973       /* lock the related dir_begin (dir begin are garbagge collected AFTER their related dir_cont)
00974        * this means that if a DIR_CONTINUE exists, its pdir pointer is not endless */
00975       P_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00976       *pattr =  pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.attributes ;
00977       V_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
00978       break ;
00979       
00980     case SOCKET_FILE:
00981     case FIFO_FILE:
00982     case BLOCK_FILE:
00983     case CHARACTER_FILE:
00984       *pattr = pentry->object.special_obj.attributes ;
00985       break ;
00986       
00987     }
00988 } /* cache_inode_get_attributes */
00989 
00990 
01003 void cache_inode_set_attributes( cache_entry_t * pentry, fsal_attrib_list_t * pattr )
01004 {
01005     switch( pentry->internal_md.type )
01006     {
01007     case REGULAR_FILE:
01008        pentry->object.file.attributes =  *pattr;
01009       break ;
01010       
01011     case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
01012       pentry->object.symlink.attributes = *pattr ;
01013       break ;
01014       
01015     case DIR_BEGINNING:
01016        pentry->object.dir_begin.attributes  = *pattr ;
01017       break ;
01018       
01019     case DIR_CONTINUE:
01020       /* lock the related dir_begin (dir begin are garbagge collected AFTER their related dir_cont)
01021        * this means that if a DIR_CONTINUE exists, its pdir pointer is not endless */
01022       P_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
01023       pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.attributes = *pattr ;
01024       V_r( &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->lock ) ;
01025       break ;
01026     
01027     case SOCKET_FILE:
01028     case FIFO_FILE:
01029     case BLOCK_FILE:
01030     case CHARACTER_FILE:
01031       pentry->object.special_obj.attributes = *pattr ;
01032       break ;      
01033     }
01034 } /* cache_inode_set_attributes */
01035 
01036 
01048 cache_inode_file_type_t cache_inode_fsal_type_convert(  fsal_nodetype_t type ) 
01049 {
01050   cache_inode_file_type_t rctype ;
01051   
01052   switch( type )
01053     {
01054     case FSAL_TYPE_DIR:
01055       rctype = DIR_BEGINNING ;
01056       break ;
01057       
01058     case FSAL_TYPE_FILE:
01059       rctype = REGULAR_FILE ;
01060       break ;
01061       
01062     case FSAL_TYPE_LNK:
01063       rctype = SYMBOLIC_LINK ;
01064       break ;
01065       
01066     case FSAL_TYPE_BLK :
01067       rctype = BLOCK_FILE ;
01068       break ;
01069       
01070     case FSAL_TYPE_FIFO:
01071       rctype = FIFO_FILE ;
01072       break ;
01073         
01074     case FSAL_TYPE_CHR:
01075       rctype = CHARACTER_FILE ;
01076       break ;
01077 
01078     case FSAL_TYPE_SOCK:
01079       rctype = SOCKET_FILE; 
01080       break;
01081 
01082     default:
01083       rctype = UNASSIGNED ;
01084       break ;
01085     }
01086 
01087   return rctype ;
01088 } /* cache_inode_fsal_type_convert */
01089 
01103 fsal_handle_t *  cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( cache_entry_t * pentry, cache_inode_status_t * pstatus ) 
01104 {
01105   fsal_handle_t * preturned_handle = NULL ;
01106   
01107   /* Set the return default to CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS */
01108   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01109 
01110   if( pentry == NULL )
01111     {
01112       preturned_handle = NULL ;
01113       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
01114     }
01115   else
01116     {
01117       switch( pentry->internal_md.type )
01118         {
01119         case REGULAR_FILE:
01120           preturned_handle = &pentry->object.file.handle ;
01121           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01122           break ;
01123           
01124         case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
01125           preturned_handle = &pentry->object.symlink.handle ;
01126           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01127           break ;
01128           
01129         case DIR_BEGINNING:
01130           preturned_handle = &pentry->object.dir_begin.handle ;
01131           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01132           break ;
01133           
01134         case DIR_CONTINUE:
01135           preturned_handle = &pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin->object.dir_begin.handle ;
01136           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01137           break ;
01138           
01139         case SOCKET_FILE:
01140         case FIFO_FILE:
01141         case BLOCK_FILE:
01142         case CHARACTER_FILE:
01143           preturned_handle = &pentry->object.special_obj.handle ;
01144           break ;      
01145           
01146         default:
01147           preturned_handle = NULL ;
01148           *pstatus =  CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
01149           break ;
01150         } /* switch( pentry->internal_md.type ) */
01151     }
01152   
01153   return preturned_handle ;
01154 } /* cache_inode_get_fsal_handle */
01155 
01156 
01169 int cache_inode_type_are_rename_compatible( cache_entry_t * pentry_src, cache_entry_t * pentry_dest )
01170 {
01171   /* Manage the case where pentry is DIR_CONTINUE */
01172   if( pentry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
01173     return  cache_inode_type_are_rename_compatible( pentry_src->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin, pentry_dest ) ;
01174   
01175   if( pentry_dest->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
01176     return  cache_inode_type_are_rename_compatible( pentry_src, pentry_dest->object.dir_cont.pdir_begin ) ;
01177   
01178   /* TRUE is both entries are non directories or to directories and the second is empty */
01179   if( pentry_src->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01180     {
01181       if( pentry_dest->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01182         {
01183           if( cache_inode_is_dir_empty( pentry_dest ) == CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01184             return TRUE ;
01185           else
01186             return FALSE ;
01187         }
01188       else
01189         return FALSE  ;
01190     }
01191   else
01192     {
01193       /* pentry_src is not a directory */
01194       if( pentry_dest->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01195         return FALSE ;
01196       else
01197         return TRUE ;
01198     }
01199 } /* cache_inode_type_are_rename_compatible */
01200 
01212 void cache_inode_mutex_destroy( cache_entry_t * pentry )
01213 {
01214   rw_lock_destroy( &pentry->lock ) ;
01215 } /* cache_inode_mutex_destroy */
01216 
01217 
01230 void cache_inode_print_dir( cache_entry_t * cache_entry_root  )
01231 {
01232    cache_entry_t * cache_entry_iter = NULL ;
01233    int i = 0 ;
01234    
01235    if( cache_entry_root->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING &&
01236        cache_entry_root->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
01237      {
01238        printf( "This entry is not a directory segment\n" ) ;
01239        return ;
01240      }
01241 
01242    cache_entry_iter = cache_entry_root ;
01243    
01244    while( cache_entry_iter != NULL ) 
01245      { 
01246        if(  cache_entry_iter->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01247          {
01248            for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
01249              printf( "Name = %s, DIR_BEGINNING entry = %p, active=%d, i=%d\n", 
01250                      cache_entry_iter->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name.name,
01251                      cache_entry_iter->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry, 
01252                      cache_entry_iter->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active,
01253                      i ) ;
01254 
01255            cache_entry_iter = cache_entry_iter->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
01256          }
01257        else
01258          {
01259            for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
01260              printf( "Name = %s, DIR_CONTINUE entry = %p, active=%d, i=%d\n",
01261                      cache_entry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].name.name, 
01262                      cache_entry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry,
01263                      cache_entry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active,
01264                      i ) ;
01265 
01266            cache_entry_iter = cache_entry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
01267          }
01268      }
01269    printf( "------------------\n" ) ;
01270 } /* cache_inode_print_dir */
01271 
01286 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_dump_content( char * path, cache_entry_t * pentry )
01287 {
01288   FILE * stream = NULL ;
01289   
01290   char   buff[CACHE_INODE_DUMP_LEN] ;
01291   
01292   if( pentry->internal_md.type != REGULAR_FILE )
01293     return CACHE_INODE_BAD_TYPE ;
01294 
01295   /* Open the index file */
01296   if( ( stream = fopen( path, "w" ) ) == NULL )
01297     return CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
01298 
01299   /* Dump the information */
01300   fprintf( stream, "internal:read_time=%d\n", (int)pentry->internal_md.read_time ) ;
01301   fprintf( stream, "internal:mod_time=%d\n",  (int)pentry->internal_md.mod_time ) ;
01302   fprintf( stream, "internal:export_id=%d\n", 0 ) ;
01303   
01304   snprintHandle( buff, CACHE_INODE_DUMP_LEN, &(pentry->object.file.handle) ) ;
01305   fprintf( stream, "file: FSAL handle=%s", buff ) ;
01306   
01307   /* Close the handle */
01308   fclose( stream ) ;
01309 
01310   return CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS   ;
01311 } /* cache_inode_dump_content */
01312 
01313 
01327 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_reload_content( char * path, cache_entry_t * pentry )
01328 {
01329    FILE * stream = NULL ;
01330 
01331    char   buff[CACHE_INODE_DUMP_LEN] ;
01332 
01333    /* Open the index file */
01334   if( ( stream = fopen( path, "r" ) ) == NULL )
01335     return CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
01336 
01337   /* The entry is a file (only file inode are dumped), in state VALID for the gc (not garbageable) */
01338   pentry->internal_md.type = REGULAR_FILE ;
01339   pentry->internal_md.valid_state = VALID ;
01340   
01341   /* Read the information */
01342   fscanf( stream, "internal:read_time=%s\n", buff) ;
01343   pentry->internal_md.read_time = atoi( buff ) ;
01344   
01345   fscanf( stream, "internal:mod_time=%s\n", buff ) ;
01346   pentry->internal_md.mod_time = atoi( buff ) ;
01347   
01348   fscanf( stream, "internal:export_id=%s\n", buff ) ;
01349     
01350   fscanf( stream, "file: FSAL handle=%s", buff ) ;
01351   if ( sscanHandle( &(pentry->object.file.handle), buff ) < 0 )
01352   {
01353         /* expected = 2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t) in hexa representation */ 
01354         DisplayLog("Error recovering cache content index %s: Invalid handle length. Expected length=%u, Found=%u",
01355                         path, (unsigned int)(2*sizeof(fsal_handle_t)), (unsigned int)strlen(buff) );
01356 
01357         return CACHE_INODE_INCONSISTENT_ENTRY;
01358   }
01359   
01360   /* Close the handle */
01361   fclose( stream ) ;
01362 
01363   return CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS   ;
01364 } /* cache_inode_reload_content */
01365 
01378 static void cache_inode_invalidate_related_dirent(  cache_entry_t            * pentry, 
01379                                                     cache_inode_client_t     * pclient )
01380 
01381 {
01382   cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter    = NULL ;
01383   
01384 
01385   /* Set the cache status as INVALID in the directory entries */
01386   for( parent_iter = pentry->parent_list ; parent_iter != NULL ; parent_iter = parent_iter->next_parent )
01387     {
01388       if( parent_iter->parent == NULL )
01389         {
01390            DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG,
01391                               "cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent: pentry %p has no parent, no dirent to be removed...", pentry ) ;
01392             continue ;
01393         } 
01394       
01395       /* If I reached this point, then parent_iter->parent is not null and is a valid cache_inode pentry */
01396       P_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
01397       
01398       /* Check for type of the parent */
01399       if( parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type != DIR_BEGINNING && 
01400           parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type != DIR_CONTINUE )
01401         {
01402           V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
01403           /* Major parent incoherency: parent is no directory */
01404           DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_DEBUG, 
01405                              "cache_inode_gc_invalidate_related_dirent: major incoherency. Found an entry whose parent is no directory" ) ;
01406           return ;
01407         }
01408       
01409       /* Set the entry as invalid in the dirent array */
01410       if( parent_iter->parent->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01411         {
01412           if( parent_iter->subdirpos > CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
01413             {
01414                 V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
01415                 DisplayLog( "A known bug occured line %d file %s: pentry=%p type=%u parent_iter->subdirpos=%d, should never exceed, entry not removed %d", 
01416                             __LINE__, __FILE__, pentry, pentry->internal_md.type, parent_iter->subdirpos, CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) ;
01417                 return ;
01418             }
01419           else
01420            {
01421               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[parent_iter->subdirpos].active = INVALID ;
01422               /* Garbagge invalidates the effet of the readdir previously made */
01423               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.has_been_readdir = CACHE_INODE_NO ;
01424               parent_iter->parent->object.dir_begin.nbactive -= 1 ;
01425            }
01426         }
01427       else
01428         {
01429           if( parent_iter->subdirpos > CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE )
01430             {
01431                 V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
01432                 DisplayLog( "A known bug occured line %d file %s: pentry=%p type=%u parent_iter->subdirpos=%d, should never exceed %d, entry not removed",
01433                             __LINE__, __FILE__, pentry, pentry->internal_md.type, parent_iter->subdirpos, CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ) ;
01434                 return ;
01435             }
01436           else
01437             {
01438                parent_iter->parent->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[parent_iter->subdirpos].active = INVALID ;
01439                parent_iter->parent->object.dir_cont.nbactive -= 1 ;
01440             }
01441         }
01442       
01443 
01444       V_w( &parent_iter->parent->lock ) ;
01445     }
01446 } /* cache_inode_invalidate_related_dirent */
01447 
01463 cache_inode_status_t cache_inode_kill_entry( cache_entry_t            * pentry, 
01464                                              hash_table_t             * ht,
01465                                              cache_inode_client_t     * pclient,
01466                                              cache_inode_status_t     * pstatus)
01467 {
01468    fsal_handle_t              * pfsal_handle     = NULL ;
01469    cache_inode_fsal_data_t      fsaldata ;
01470    cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter      = NULL ;
01471    cache_inode_parent_entry_t * parent_iter_next = NULL ;
01472    hash_buffer_t                key , old_key;
01473    hash_buffer_t                old_value ;
01474    int                          rc ;
01475    int                          i ;
01476    fsal_status_t                fsal_status ;
01477    cache_entry_t              * pentry_iter = NULL ;
01478    cache_entry_t              * pentry_iter_save = NULL ;
01479    cache_inode_status_t         kill_status ;
01480 
01481    DisplayLog( "Using cache_inode_kill_entry for entry %p", pentry ) ;
01482 
01483    if( pstatus == NULL )
01484         return CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
01485 
01486    if( pentry == NULL || pclient == NULL || ht == NULL ) 
01487      {
01488         *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_INVALID_ARGUMENT ;
01489         return *pstatus ;
01490      }
01491 
01492    /* Get the FSAL handle */
01493    if( ( pfsal_handle = cache_inode_get_fsal_handle( pentry, pstatus ) ) == NULL )
01494     {
01495       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
01496                          "cache_inode_kill_entry: unable to retrieve pentry's specific filesystem info" ) ;
01497       return *pstatus ;
01498     }
01499 
01500    /* Invalidate the related LRU gc entry (no more required) */
01501    if( pentry->gc_lru_entry != NULL )
01502     {
01503       if( LRU_invalidate( pentry->gc_lru, pentry->gc_lru_entry ) != LRU_LIST_SUCCESS )
01504         {
01505           *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_LRU_ERROR;
01506           return *pstatus ;
01507         }
01508     }
01509     
01510    fsaldata.handle = *pfsal_handle ;
01511 
01512    if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE ) 
01513      fsaldata.cookie = pentry->object.dir_cont.dir_cont_pos ;
01514    else
01515      fsaldata.cookie = DIR_START ;
01516 
01517   /* Use the handle to build the key */
01518   if( cache_inode_fsaldata_2_key( &key, &fsaldata, pclient ) )
01519     {
01520       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
01521                          "cache_inode_kill_entry: could not build hashtable key" ) ;
01522 
01523       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient );
01524       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND ; 
01525       return *pstatus ;
01526     }
01527 
01528    
01529   /* Remove the whole dir_chain from the cache */
01530   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01531    {
01532      pentry_iter = pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_cont ;
01533      while( pentry_iter != NULL ) 
01534       {
01535         pentry_iter_save = pentry_iter->object.dir_cont.pdir_cont ;
01536 
01537         if( cache_inode_kill_entry( pentry_iter, ht, pclient, &kill_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01538                 DisplayLog( "cache_inode_kill_entry: could not kill pentry %p of type %u", pentry_iter, pentry_iter->internal_md.type ) ;
01539         
01540         pentry_iter = pentry_iter_save ;
01541        }
01542     }
01543 
01544   /* Clean parent entries */
01545   cache_inode_invalidate_related_dirent( pentry, pclient ) ;
01546   
01547   /* use the key to delete the entry */
01548   if( ( rc = HashTable_Del( ht, &key, &old_key, &old_value ) ) != HASHTABLE_SUCCESS )
01549     {
01550       DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
01551                          "cache_inode_kill_entry: entry could not be deleted, status = %d", rc ) ;
01552 
01553       cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient );
01554             
01555       *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_NOT_FOUND ; 
01556       return *pstatus ;
01557     }
01558 
01559   
01560   /* Clean up the associated ressources in the FSAL */
01561   if( FSAL_IS_ERROR(  fsal_status = FSAL_CleanObjectResources( pfsal_handle ) ) )
01562     {
01563        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
01564                          "cache_inode_kill_entry: Could'nt free FSAL ressources fsal_status.major=%u", fsal_status.major ) ;
01565     }
01566 
01567   /* Release the hash key data */ 
01568   cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &old_key, pclient );
01569 
01570   /* Sanity check: old_value.pdata is expected to be equal to pentry,
01571    * and is released later in this function */
01572   if ( (cache_entry_t*)old_value.pdata != pentry )
01573   {
01574        DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT,
01575                          "cache_inode_kill_entry: unexpected pdata %p from hash table (pentry=%p)",
01576                           old_value.pdata, pentry ) ;
01577   }
01578   
01579   /* Release the current key */
01580   cache_inode_release_fsaldata_key( &key, pclient );
01581 
01582    /* Recover the parent list entries */
01583   parent_iter = pentry->parent_list  ;
01584   while( parent_iter != NULL ) 
01585     {
01586       parent_iter_next = parent_iter->next_parent ;
01587 
01588       RELEASE_PREALLOC( parent_iter, pclient->pool_parent, next_alloc ) ;
01589    
01590       parent_iter = parent_iter_next ;
01591     }
01592  
01593   /* If entry is datacached, remove it from the cache */
01594   if( pentry->internal_md.type == REGULAR_FILE )
01595    {
01596      cache_content_status_t cache_content_status ;
01597 
01598      if( pentry->object.file.pentry_content != NULL )
01599         if( cache_content_release_entry( (cache_content_entry_t  *)pentry->object.file.pentry_content,
01600                                          (cache_content_client_t *)pclient->pcontent_client,
01601                                          &cache_content_status )  != CACHE_CONTENT_SUCCESS )
01602                 DisplayLogJdLevel( pclient->log_outputs, NIV_CRIT, "Could not removed datacached entry for pentry %p", pentry ) ;
01603    }
01604  
01605   /* If entry is a DIR_CONTINUE or a DIR_BEGINNING, release pdir_data */
01606   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_BEGINNING )
01607     {
01608       for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
01609         {
01610            pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active = INVALID ;
01611            pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry = NULL ;
01612         }
01613       /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
01614       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry->object.dir_begin.pdir_data, pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
01615     }
01616 
01617   if( pentry->internal_md.type == DIR_CONTINUE )
01618     {
01619       for( i = 0 ; i < CHILDREN_ARRAY_SIZE ; i++ )
01620         {
01621            pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].active = INVALID ;
01622            pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data->dir_entries[i].pentry = NULL ;
01623         }
01624       /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
01625       RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry->object.dir_cont.pdir_data, pclient->pool_dir_data, next_alloc ) ;
01626     }
01627  
01628   
01629   /* Put the pentry back to the pool */
01630   RELEASE_PREALLOC( pentry, pclient->pool_entry, next_alloc ) ;
01631 
01632   /* Destroy the mutex associated with the pentry */
01633   cache_inode_mutex_destroy( pentry ) ;
01634 
01635   *pstatus = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ;
01636   return *pstatus ; 
01637 } /* cache_inode_kill_entry */
01638 
01639 #ifdef _USE_PROXY
01640 void nfs4_sprint_fhandle( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, char * outstr ) ;
01641 
01642 void cache_inode_print_srvhandle( char * comment, cache_entry_t * pentry )
01643 {
01644    fsal_handle_t * pfsal_handle ;
01645    nfs_fh4         nfsfh ;
01646    char            tag[30] ;
01647    char            outstr[1024] ;
01648 
01649    if( pentry == NULL ) 
01650         return ;
01651 
01652    switch( pentry->internal_md.type ) 
01653     {
01654         case REGULAR_FILE:
01655             strcpy( tag, "file" );
01656             pfsal_handle = &(pentry->object.file.handle) ;
01657             break ;
01658 
01659         case SYMBOLIC_LINK:
01660             strcpy( tag, "link" );
01661             pfsal_handle = &(pentry->object.symlink.handle ) ;
01662             break ;
01663 
01664         case DIR_BEGINNING:
01665             strcpy( tag, "dir " );
01666             pfsal_handle = &(pentry->object.dir_begin.handle ) ;
01667             break ;
01668 
01669         default:
01670             return ;
01671             break ;
01672     }
01673 
01674    nfsfh.nfs_fh4_len = pfsal_handle->srv_handle_len ;
01675    nfsfh.nfs_fh4_val = pfsal_handle->srv_handle_val ;
01676   
01677    nfs4_sprint_fhandle( &nfsfh, outstr ) ;
01678 
01679    DisplayLog( "-->-->-->-->--> External FH (%s) comment=%s = %s", tag, comment, outstr ) ;
01680 } /* cache_inode_print_srvhandle */
01681 #endif
